sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Smoke rises above Kyiv as Russia claims it has hit material production sites in the capital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, President Zelenskyy appeals for more military support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine says Russian forces have attacked an oil refinery in Lysychansk as shelling intensifies in the country's east.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russia has barred the British Prime Minister Boris Johnson and other UK officials from entering the country in response to London's sanctions on Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Smoke rises above Kiev, darkening the skies just one day after Russia vowed to step up missile strikes on Ukraine's capital in response to what it calls terrorist-type attacks carried out on its territory by Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin has said that 16 targets were destroyed in the strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: High-precision long-range air-launched weapons destroyed production buildings of an armaments plant in Kyiv and a workshop for repairing military equipment in Mykolaiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It may have been in direct response to the sinking of the flagship of the Russian Black Sea Fleet, the Moskva.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Neptune missiles were made at one of the targeted sites, which Ukraine says it used to sink the cruiser.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow however blames the damage on a fire and stormy seas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: In its nightly address, President Zelensky once again appealed for more weapons to be sent to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The sooner we get all the weapons we have requested, the stronger our position will be, and the sooner there will be peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In the meantime, the citizens of Brovary bury their dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Today it was the turn of a 13-year-old boy, killed while the territory around Kyiv was held by Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Smoke billows from an oil refinery in Lysychansk in eastern Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Authorities there say it has been shelled by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Its regional governor says this isn't the first time the refinery has been shelled by Russian forces. Its regional governor says this isn't the first time the refinery has been targeted, accusing Moscow of trying to exhaust local emergency services. In Ukraine's second largest city, Kharkiv, authorities say rockets have hit a residential area, killing at least one person and injuring 18 others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Amid burned cars and debris, there are bloodied people on the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Firefighters are still putting out the flames and helping evacuate dozens of people from damaged buildings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The local government says half of Kharkiv's two million citizens have left. Some were not so lucky. In Chernihiv, sounds of construction replace air raids. The city was constantly under attack from Russian forces until suddenly they withdrew.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Now residents pick up the pieces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: How are you? Nice to see you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Just a week ago, British Prime Minister Boris Johnson was with the Ukrainian leader Vladimir Zelensky to show his support for Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And now Moscow has barred Johnson and a dozen other UK officials from entering Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin said the move was due to British sanctions on Russia, as well as helping to marshal its international isolation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This week we will announce that we've frozen over 350 billion dollars of Putin's war chest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: But these may have had an effect too. This one was shot from this beautiful from this beautiful thing. Britain has been at the forefront of offering military support to Kyiv such as these next generation light anti-tank weapons.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They are crucial in allowing Ukraine's forces to fight back against superior Russian firepower.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: allowing Ukraine's forces to fight back against superior Russian firepower. Ignoring police orders, a man in the Russian city of Khabarovsk defiantly shows his support

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: for Ukraine, until his sign is taken from him.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Officers have arrested two people there demonstrating against the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: There have been consistent protests across Russian cities denouncing what Moscow is calling a special military operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Thousands have been detained, and the Kremlin is doubling down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In Lithuania, women gather outside the Russian embassy in the capital, some in their underwear, many with bags over their heads.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They're protesting against alleged incidences of rape and violence against Ukrainian women and children by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Organisers were inspired by a similar protest in Estonia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They know the 20-minute act is confronting, but say it's necessary to get their message across to show what's happening in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This was the scene in Orebro, Sweden, on Friday, as people violently clashed with the police, sparked off by a far-right group's intention to hold a demonstration in which they planned to burn a Koran.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Twelve police officers were injured and four police vehicles were set on fire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And now, authorities say they're preparing for a new round of disturbances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The deputy chief of police in the city says, It's tragic, terribly tragic, to show such disregard and to engage in violence and vandalism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It affected the ability of the police in our city to protect our constitutionally inscribed rights. It affected the ability of the police in our city to protect our constitutionally inscribed rights." The line between hate speech and acceptable expression are increasingly thorny issues in the West.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A police spokeswoman said permission will not be revoked for the far-right demonstration, citing free speech grounds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the rally would be moved to another undisclosed location.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Who do the streets belong to?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Us, replies the crowd, gathered to express their distaste to both Marine Le Pen and Emmanuel Macron in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's Le Pen and Macron who must be fired, they continue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This protest is part of a national mobilisation against the far right and their candidate Marine Le Pen, just eight days before the second round of the French presidential election.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Many have voted for leftist or green candidates in the first round.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Who they give their vote to in the second round, or whether they decide to vote at all, will be crucial in deciding who sits in the Lise Palace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Three generations from the Kim family have ruled over North Korea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Today, the current leader, Kim Jong-un, celebrated the 110th anniversary of the birth of his state-founding grandfather, Kim Il-sung.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The festivities occurred while tensions between the West and North Korea are rising. The isolated country began 2022 with a slew of weapons tests including its first test flight of an ICBM since 2017. Thousands of citizens lined the streets of the capital Pyongyang but the lavish ceremony was largely civilian in nature.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Unlike other national days of celebration, no military hardware was on display.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Still, experts expect North Korea to continue ramping up weapons tests, with the war in Ukraine providing a useful distraction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Extinction Rebellion movement has blocked traffic in Paris,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: protesting against so-called climate inaction by the government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The demonstration is staged a week before the second round of the French presidential elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: They're bringing roads to a standstill with barricades of haystacks and organized sit-ins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Activists say the goal is to bring climate issues to the center of the presidential debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: activists say the goal is to bring climate issues to the centre of the presidential debate. A whale washed ashore in the Portuguese city of Almada has died.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Maritime police made several attempts to rescue the mammal, but it did not survive its injuries and being out of water for a whole day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: An autopsy will be conducted on Monday, but experts have already observed deep wounds which appear to confirm that the whale was knocked down by a ship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In Coruña, Spain, the Barrié Foundation is hosting an exhibition, Textiles of Artists, organised by the Fashion and Textile Museum of London.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The exhibition offers a journey through the history of 20th century art through fabrics designed by representatives of movements such as Fauvism, Cubism, Abstraction, Surrealism and Pop Art.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Swiss documentary film festival Vision du Riel has opened in Nyon with homage to Lithuanian director Manteskva Daravisius who was killed while filming in Mariupol in Ukraine at the beginning of the month. It is one of the leading documentary festivals in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The MUSEUM in Marseille is devoting an exhibition to the Sufi scholar Ad Elkader, who opposed the French conquest of Algeria in 1830.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Seen as a national hero by Algerians, the religious and military leader is not well known in France.
